TopicTitle: 7R45H-CN and 7R45H-7RK: The solution to your debris problem!

Articles.Content:
Warranty void if used to hold trash. Trash-co assumes no liability for any damage or explosions caused by the use of this craft. May contribute to space-borne trash. At least 98% trash by weight.

7R45H-CN:

http://herpnderp.info/7R45H-CN.craft

Now with 300% more trash! (not to scale)

7R45H-7RK:

http://herpnderp.info/7R45H-7RK.craft

Note: do not grab large things with 7R45H-CN's arms, or they may break. 7R45H-7RK has control groups 1-4 bound to the arms, so you can grab things of different sizes using the 1-4 keys. Do not warp while trash is in the bin, or it may warp through or into the ship. Dispose of all trash promptly by retroburning until the periapsis is below 10km, then using your RCS to carefully back the trash out through the opening before re-circularizing your orbit.

Edited May 23, 2013 by Colonel_Panic

Hey Everyone!

New to the game and I found this thread through Google. How exactly would I copy that text in the link into the ships folder. Not sure how to make a .craft file. Thanks!
Nevermind I figured it out! Google is cool that way.

Cool! A space vacuum. I like the Box design. I've been using this with great success:

My Squid Deorbiter Claw. Pretty neat to see two different takes on the same problem. I am so messy... we won't talk about how many pieces of Junk I can see in the Tracking Center.

I don't get it.

Toy Box Lives is a manga/movie/anime about a crew that removes space debris, much akin to what this space craft is supposed to do. I think Big is talking about an early iteration of the space debris collection vehicle in the story.

Edit: I really want to actually try this now Can these handle parts that are 2m wide?

the big one should, just don't rely on the arms... the idea behind the wide box/basket design is you can just line up and push just about anything out of orbit with it

I've got an idea for a "stomach": first drain all resources from the part, then grab it so it stays fixed in a chamber and fire multiple rocket engines so the jets heat the object until it explodes.
